title: Understanding Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way of expressing very large or very small numbers. It is written as the product of a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$, and a power of $$10$$.

title: Identifying the Coefficient
text: The number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ in scientific notation is called the coefficient. Identify the coefficient from the given number.

title: Finding the Coefficient
text: Determine the coefficient for the number 1,000,000,000,000 when expressed in scientific notation.

title: Counting the Decimal Places
text: The power of $$10$$ represents the number of decimal places you move to get the coefficient. Count the number of decimal places in 1,000,000,000,000.

title: Determining the Power of $$10$$
text: Calculate the power of $$10$$ to represent the original number with the identified coefficient.

title: Combining the Coefficient and Power
text: To write the number 1,000,000,000,000 in scientific notation, combine the coefficient and the power of $$10$$ determined from the previous steps.
